name: diversification
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the process of starting to include more different types or things: Diversification of your investments lowers risk. The policy may also offer improved energy security through diversification of energy sources.
[ U or C ]
  business
  specialized the process of starting to make new products or offer new services, or an instance of this: The government offered help for diversification into new farm products and food processing. For the company, it's a sensible diversification of their product range. See
diversify
More examplesFewer examplesThe article encouraged diversification of investments.Intensified counselling, diversification of treatment options, and hepatitis B immunization all have a role. The two initiatives highlight the potential benefits of diversification but they also underline the risks of managing vastly disparate businesses.They started the natural burials as a farm diversification.
